title: Get started with nominatimlite
text: main goal nominatimlite access Nominatim API avoiding dependency curl. situations, curl may available accessible, nominatimlite uses base functions overcome limitation.

title: Get started with nominatimlite
text: packages much complete mature nominatimlite, presents similar features: tidygeocoder Jesse Cambon. Allows interface Nominatim, Google, TomTom, Mapbox, etc. geocoding reverse geocoding. osmdata Mark Padgham. Great downloading spatial data OpenStreetMap, via Overpass API.

title: Get started with nominatimlite
text: nominatimlite can extract spatial objects easily: plot chunk McDonalds can also extract polygon line objects (available) using option points_only = FALSE: plot chunk penta
code: library(nominatimlite)  # Extract some points - McDonalds in California  LA <- geo_lite_sf("California", points_only = FALSE)  McDonalds <- geo_lite_sf("McDonalds, California",   limit = 50,   custom_query = list(countrycodes = "us") )  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(LA) +   geom_sf() +   geom_sf(data = McDonalds, col = "red") pentagon_poly <- geo_lite_sf("Pentagon", points_only = FALSE)  ggplot(pentagon_poly) +   geom_sf()

title: Get started with nominatimlite
text: Note: examples adapted tidygeocoder package first example geocode addresses using geo_lite() function: latitude longitude returned geocoder service example, full_results = TRUE can used return data geocoder service. perform reverse geocoding (obtaining addresses geographic coordinates), can use reverse_geo_lite() function. arguments similar geo_lite() function, now specify input data columns lat long arguments. dataset used geocoder query . single line address returned column named address. advance users, see Nominatim docs check parameters available.
code: library(tibble)  # create a dataframe with addresses some_addresses <- tribble(   ~name,                  ~addr,   "White House",          "1600 Pennsylvania Ave NW, Washington, DC",   "Transamerica Pyramid", "600 Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94111",   "Willis Tower",         "233 S Wacker Dr, Chicago, IL 60606" )  # geocode the addresses lat_longs <- geo_lite(some_addresses$addr, lat = "latitude", long = "longitude") reverse <- reverse_geo_lite(   lat = lat_longs$latitude, long = lat_longs$longitude,   address = "address_found" )

what: nominatimlite | Connection with OSM Nominatim API
title: nominatimlite | Connection with OSM Nominatim API
text: goal nominatimlite provide light interface geocoding addresses, based Nominatim API. Nominatim tool search OpenStreetMap data name address (geocoding) generate synthetic addresses OSM points (reverse geocoding). also allows load spatial objects using sf package. Full site examples vignettes https://dieghernan.github.io/nominatimlite/

title: nominatimlite | Connection with OSM Nominatim API
text: main goal nominatimlite access Nominatim API avoiding dependency curl. situations, curl may available accessible, nominatimlite uses base functions overcome limitation.

title: nominatimlite | Connection with OSM Nominatim API
text: packages much complete mature nominatimlite, presents similar features: tidygeocoder Jesse Cambon. Allows interface Nominatim, Google, TomTom, Mapbox, etc. geocoding reverse geocoding. osmdata Mark Padgham. Great downloading spatial data OpenStreetMap, via Overpass API.

title: nominatimlite | Connection with OSM Nominatim API
text: Install nominatimlite CRAN: can install developing version nominatimlite : Alternatively, can install nominatimlite using r-universe:
code: install.packages("nominatimlite") devtools::install_github("dieghernan/nominatimlite") # Enable this universe options(repos = c(   dieghernan = "https://dieghernan.r-universe.dev",   CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org" ))   install.packages("nominatimlite")

title: nominatimlite | Connection with OSM Nominatim API
text: nominatimlite can extract spatial objects easily:  can also extract polygon line objects (provided Nominatim API) using option points_only = FALSE:
code: library(nominatimlite)  # Extract some points - McDonalds in California  LA <- geo_lite_sf("California", points_only = FALSE)  McDonalds <- geo_lite_sf("McDonalds, California",   limit = 50,   custom_query = list(countrycodes = "us") )  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(LA) +   geom_sf() +   geom_sf(data = McDonalds, col = "red") pentagon_poly <- geo_lite_sf("Pentagon", points_only = FALSE) # a building - a polygon  ggplot(pentagon_poly) +   geom_sf() dayton <- geo_lite_sf("Dayton, OH") # default - a point ohio_state <- geo_lite_sf("Ohio, USA", points_only = FALSE) # a US state - a polygon ohio_river <- geo_lite_sf("Ohio river", points_only = FALSE) # a river - a line  ggplot() +   geom_sf(data = ohio_state) +   geom_sf(data = dayton, color = "red", pch = 4) +   geom_sf(data = ohio_river, color = "blue")

title: nominatimlite | Connection with OSM Nominatim API
text: Note: examples adapted tidygeocoder package first example geocode addresses using geo_lite() function: latitude longitude returned geocoder service example, full_results = TRUE can used return data geocoder service. perform reverse geocoding (obtaining addresses geographic coordinates), can use reverse_geo_lite() function. arguments similar geo_lite() function, now specify input data columns lat long arguments. dataset used geocoder query . single line address returned column named address. advance users, see Nominatim docs check parameters available.
code: library(tibble)  # create a dataframe with addresses some_addresses <- tribble(   ~name,                  ~addr,   "White House",          "1600 Pennsylvania Ave NW, Washington, DC",   "Transamerica Pyramid", "600 Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94111",   "Willis Tower",         "233 S Wacker Dr, Chicago, IL 60606" )  # geocode the addresses lat_longs <- geo_lite(some_addresses$addr, lat = "latitude", long = "longitude") reverse <- reverse_geo_lite(   lat = lat_longs$latitude, long = lat_longs$longitude,   address = "address_found" )

title: nominatimlite | Connection with OSM Nominatim API
text: need citation, use:
code: citation("nominatimlite") #>  #> To cite the 'nominatimlite' package in publications use: #>  #> Hernangómez D (2021). _nominatimlite: Interface with 'Nominatim' API #> Service_. doi: 10.5281/zenodo.5113195 (URL: #> https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5113195), R package version 0.1.2, <URL: #> https://dieghernan.github.io/nominatimlite/>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {nominatimlite: Interface with 'Nominatim' API Service}, #>     year = {2021}, #>     note = {R package version 0.1.2}, #>     version = {0.1.2}, #>     author = {Diego Hernangómez}, #>     doi = {10.5281/zenodo.5113195}, #>     url = {https://dieghernan.github.io/nominatimlite/}, #>   }

title: Create a bounding box sf object — bbox_to_poly
code: bbox_to_poly(bbox = NA, xmin = NA, ymin = NA, xmax = NA, ymax = NA, crs = 4326)

title: Create a bounding box sf object — bbox_to_poly
text: bbox numeric vector 4 elements representing coordinates bounding box. Values c(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax)

title: Create a bounding box sf object — bbox_to_poly
text: xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax alternatively, can use named parameters instead bbox

title: Create a bounding box sf object — bbox_to_poly
text: crs coordinate reference system, something suitable input st_crs

title: Create a bounding box sf object — bbox_to_poly
text: sf object

title: Create a bounding box sf object — bbox_to_poly
text: Bounding boxes can located using different online tools, Bounding Box Tool.

what: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
text: Geocodes addresses OSM objects, identified OSM Id.

title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
code: geo_address_lookup(   osm_ids,   type,   lat = "lat",   long = "lon",   full_results = FALSE,   return_addresses = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE,   custom_query = list() )

title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
text: osm_ids vector OSM identifiers (c(00000, 11111, 22222)).

title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
text: type vector type OSM type associated osm_ids. Possible values node ("N"), way ("W") relation ("R"). single value provided recycled.#'

title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
text: lat latitude column name (.e. "lat").

title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
text: long longitude column name (.e. "long").

title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
text: full_results returns data geocoder service TRUE. FALSE longitude latitude returned geocoder service.

title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
text: return_addresses return input addresses results TRUE. Note services return input addresses full_results = TRUE setting return_addresses FALSE prevent .

title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
text: verbose TRUE detailed logs output console

title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
text: custom_query API-specific parameters used, passed named list (.e. list(countrycodes = "US")). See Details.

title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
text: tibble results.

title: Query the address and other details of one or multiple OSM objects — geo_address_lookup
text: See https://nominatim.org/release-docs/develop/api/Lookup/ additional parameters passed custom_query.

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: function search amenities defined OpenStreetMap restricted area defined bounding box form (<min_latitude>, <min_longitude>, <max_latitude>, <max_longitude>).

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
code: geo_amenity(   bbox,   amenity,   lat = "lat",   long = "lon",   limit = 1,   full_results = FALSE,   return_addresses = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE,   custom_query = list(),   strict = FALSE )

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: bbox numeric vector latitude longitude (<min_latitude>, <min_longitude>, <max_latitude>, <max_longitude>) restrict search area. See Details.

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: amenity character vector character amenities geolocated (.e. c("pub", "restaurant")). See Details osm_amenities.

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: lat latitude column name (.e. "lat").

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: long longitude column name (.e. "long").

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: limit maximum number results return per input address. Note query returns maximum 50 results.

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: full_results returns data geocoder service TRUE. FALSE longitude latitude returned geocoder service.

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: return_addresses return input addresses results TRUE. Note services return input addresses full_results = TRUE setting return_addresses FALSE prevent .

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: verbose TRUE detailed logs output console

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: custom_query API-specific parameters used. See geo_lite().

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: strict Logical TRUE/FALSE. Force results included inside bbox. Note Nominatim default behaviour may return results located outside provided bounding box.

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: tibble results.

title: Geocode amenities — geo_amenity
text: Bounding boxes can located using different online tools, Bounding Box Tool. full list valid amenities see https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:amenity.

what: Get spatial objects through geocoding — geo_lite_sf
title: Get spatial objects through geocoding — geo_lite_sf
text: function allows geocode addresses return corresponding spatial object. parameter points_only specifies whether function results points (Nominatim results guaranteed least point geometry) possibly spatial objects. Note type geometry returned case points_only = FALSE depend object geocoded: administrative areas, major buildings like returned polygons rivers, roads like lines amenities may points even case points_only = FALSE call function vectorized, allowing multiple addresses geocoded; case points_only = FALSE  multiple geometry types may returned.

title: Get spatial objects through geocoding — geo_lite_sf
code: geo_lite_sf(   address,   limit = 1,   return_addresses = TRUE,   full_results = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   custom_query = list(),   points_only = TRUE )

title: Get spatial objects through geocoding — geo_lite_sf
text: return_addresses return input addresses results TRUE. Note services return input addresses full_results = TRUE setting return_addresses FALSE prevent .

title: Get spatial objects through geocoding — geo_lite_sf
text: full_results returns data geocoder service TRUE. FALSE longitude latitude returned geocoder service.

title: Get spatial objects through geocoding — geo_lite_sf
text: verbose TRUE detailed logs output console

title: Get spatial objects through geocoding — geo_lite_sf
text: custom_query API-specific parameters used, passed named list (.e. list(countrycodes = "US")). See Details.

what: nominatimlite: Interface with 'Nominatim' API Service — nominatimlite-package
title: nominatimlite: Interface with 'Nominatim' API Service — nominatimlite-package
text: Lite interface getting data 'OSM' service 'Nominatim' <https://nominatim.org/release-docs/latest/>. Extract coordinates addresses, find places near set coordinates, search amenities return spatial objects 'sf' format.

title: nominatimlite: Interface with 'Nominatim' API Service — nominatimlite-package
text: Maintainer: Diego Hernangómez diego.hernangomezherrero@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder] contributors: Jindra Lacko [contributor, reviewer] OpenStreetMap contributors (data.) [copyright holder]

title: Reverse geocode coordinates — reverse_geo_lite
text: Reverse geocodes geographic coordinates (latitude longitude) given numeric values. Latitudes must -90 90 longitudes must -180 180.

title: Reverse geocode coordinates — reverse_geo_lite
code: reverse_geo_lite(   lat,   long,   address = "address",   full_results = FALSE,   return_coords = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE,   custom_query = list() )

title: Reverse geocode coordinates — reverse_geo_lite
text: lat latitude values (input data)

title: Reverse geocode coordinates — reverse_geo_lite
text: long longitude values (input data)

title: Reverse geocode coordinates — reverse_geo_lite
text: address name address column (output data)

title: Reverse geocode coordinates — reverse_geo_lite
text: full_results returns data geocoder service TRUE. FALSE single address column returned geocoder service.

title: Reverse geocode coordinates — reverse_geo_lite
text: return_coords return input coordinates results TRUE. Note services return input coordinates full_results = TRUE setting return_coords FALSE prevent .

title: Reverse geocode coordinates — reverse_geo_lite
text: verbose TRUE detailed logs output console

title: Reverse geocode coordinates — reverse_geo_lite
text: custom_query API-specific parameters used, passed named list (ie. list(zoom = 3)). See Details.

title: Reverse geocode coordinates — reverse_geo_lite
text: tibble results.

title: Reverse geocode coordinates — reverse_geo_lite
text: See https://nominatim.org/release-docs/develop/api/Reverse/ additional parameters passed custom_query. Use option custom_query = list(zoom = 3) adjust output. equivalences terms zoom:
